When δ-Bi 2O 3 is cooled from a high temperature, a phase transition to the β phase takes place at 650 °C. Also, the metastable γ-Bi 2O 3 is formed below 650 °C on cooling δ-Bi 2O 3. The structure of β-Bi 2O 3 is a fluorite-based structure, but 25% of the oxide anion is regularly deficient.
25 Although the β and δ phases are unstainable at room temperature, they can be stabilized at room temperature when other cations are introduced into the Bi 3+ site to form solid solutions. In fact, niobium- and tantalum-doped (Bi 1– x M
x ) 2O 3+2 x (M = Nb or Ta) solid solutions adopt β phase and δ phase at room temperature, respectively, to exhibit high oxide anion conductivity.
20 Although Nb 5+-doped Bi 2O 3 has been reported as an inorganic reddish-yellow pigment,
26 there is no report on the color evaluation of Ta 5+-doped Bi 2O 3 as an inorganic pigment.
